subject: p10715477
Findings: Comparison is made with prior study,. Severe cardiomegaly is stable. There is a hiatal hernia. Right upper lobe peripheral opacity is chronic, represent superimposition of normal structures and hypertrophy of the first right costochondral junction. There are minimal bibasilar atelectases. There is no pneumothorax or pleural effusion. Sternal wires are aligned. The aorta is tortuous. The azygos vein is distended. No evidence of CHF.
